title: CLI & Program Skeleton
description:
Background
- Establishes the Rust crate layout and CLI entry points for rvl.

Goals
- Provide a stable binary entry (rvl) and module boundaries aligned to docs/PLAN_RVL.md.
- Centralize argument parsing, validation, and exit codes.

Deliverables
- Cargo crate layout (src/main.rs + modules).
- clap-based CLI with required args and flags.
- Error/exit-code routing consistent with spec.

title: Encoding guardrails tests
description:
Background
- UTF-16/32 and NUL detection must refuse deterministically.

Scope
- Fixtures for UTF-16/UTF-32 BOM and NUL in first 8KB.
- Verify E_ENCODING refusal output and Next remediation.

Acceptance
- Guardrails trigger before any CSV parsing or diffing.

title: Exit codes & stdout/stderr routing
description:
Background
- The spec defines exit codes and stream routing for human vs JSON mode.

Scope
- Map outcomes to exit codes: NO REAL CHANGE=0, REAL CHANGE=1, REFUSAL=2.
- Human mode: REAL/NO REAL -> stdout; REFUSAL -> stderr.
- JSON mode: always emit a single object on stdout for domain outcomes; stderr only for process-level failures.

Considerations
- Ensure process-level failures (panic, CLI parse errors) do not emit partial JSON.
- Keep routing logic centralized.

Acceptance
- All paths comply with stream rules and exit codes in docs/PLAN_RVL.md.

title: Normalization & Identifier Encoding
description:
Background
- Spec requires ASCII-trimmed headers/keys and deterministic identifier rendering.

Goals
- Normalize headers (trim + __rvl_col_ names) and enforce uniqueness.
- Provide u8:/hex: encoding for identifiers in both human and JSON outputs.

Deliverables
- Shared helpers for ASCII trim and identifier encoding.
- Header normalization + duplicate detection (E_HEADERS).

title: Parser bakeoff benchmarks (required before v0 done)
description:
Background
- PLAN_RVL.md requires a parser bakeoff before declaring v0 complete.

Scope
- Benchmark Rust csv vs candidates (SIMD CSV, Arrow/Polars if viable).
- Measure throughput (rows/sec), peak RSS, and compatibility on corpus.
- If non-Rust wins by >=25% with equal compatibility and acceptable memory, plan FFI or port.

Acceptance
- Bakeoff report recorded in-repo with conclusions and next steps.

title: Numeric parsing format tests
description:
Background
- Numeric parsing supports a specific set of finance-friendly formats.

Scope
- Tests for plain numbers, scientific notation, thousands separators, currency prefix, and accounting parentheses.
- Negative and + sign variants per spec.

Acceptance
- All numeric examples in docs/PLAN_RVL.md parse and compare correctly.

title: Identifier rendering for human output
description:
Background
- Human output must be deterministic and non-lossy for row IDs and column names.

Scope
- Implement u8:/hex: rules for rendering identifiers in human output.
- If valid UTF-8 with no ASCII control bytes and not starting with u8:/hex:, print as-is.
- If valid UTF-8 but starts with u8:/hex:, prefix with u8:.
- Otherwise render as hex:<lowercase-hex>.

Acceptance
- Human output never emits ambiguous identifiers.

title: CSV torture corpus (>=50 fixtures)
description:
Background
- The spec requires a real-world CSV corpus before declaring v0 done.

Scope
- Collect >=50 CSV fixtures from Excel, Sheets, vendors, SEC tables, etc.
- Each fixture must parse or refuse for a precise reason.
- Track expected dialect, escape mode, and refusal codes where applicable.

Acceptance
- Corpus is versioned in-repo with deterministic expected outcomes.

title: Phase - Future Work: Numeric diff over time windows
description:
Background
- v1 idea to compare across time windows rather than single file pairs.

Goals
- Define windowing semantics, aggregation, and output changes.
- Identify whether this conflicts with rvlâ€™s minimal-change ethos.

Acceptance
- Decision doc with pros/cons and a proposed spec if pursued.

title: JSON output schema assembly
description:
Background
- --json mode requires a single stable object with exact fields.

Scope
- Implement the full v0 JSON schema (version/outcome/files/alignment/dialect/threshold/tolerance/counts/metrics/limits/contributors/refusal).
- Ensure identifiers are encoded and numeric fields are finite.
- For E_NEED_KEY, suppress numeric metrics and cell counts per spec.

Acceptance
- JSON output matches docs/PLAN_RVL.md schema and passes golden tests.

title: Row-order alignment & shuffle detection tests
description:
Background
- Shuffle detection prevents misleading row-order diffs.

Scope
- Tests for E_ROWCOUNT in no-key mode.
- Tests for E_NEED_KEY when perfect key candidate indicates reordering.

Acceptance
- E_NEED_KEY suppresses metrics and suggests --key.

title: Record width normalization & E_HEADERS
description:
Background
- Rows may be shorter than header; extra fields must be empty or refusal.

Scope
- Pad short rows with empty fields for comparison.
- If a row has extra trailing fields and any are non-empty after ASCII-trim, refuse E_HEADERS.
- Report first offending data record number.

Acceptance
- Variable-width CSVs follow the exact rules in docs/PLAN_RVL.md.

title: Key column parsing and validation
description:
Background
- --key accepts raw string, u8:<...>, or hex:<...> identifiers.

Scope
- Parse --key into normalized header identifier bytes.
- Validate key column existence in both files; refuse E_NO_KEY if missing.
- Ensure key values are ASCII-trimmed and non-empty (E_KEY_EMPTY).

Acceptance
- Key parsing is unambiguous and matches identifier encoding rules.

title: Row-order alignment & row count validation
description:
Background
- Without --key, rows are aligned by position and must have equal non-blank record counts.

Scope
- Implement lockstep iteration over old/new files in row-order mode.
- Count non-blank records; refuse E_ROWCOUNT on mismatch.
- Generate row_id as 1-based data record index (blank records skipped).

Acceptance
- Row-order alignment follows the fast-path rules and produces correct row IDs.

title: Missingness mismatch refusal (E_MISSINGNESS)
description:
Background
- Numeric vs missing on one side is a meaningful change but v0 refuses.

Scope
- Detect any cell where one side is missing and the other is numeric.
- Emit E_MISSINGNESS with the first concrete example (file/row/column/value).

Acceptance
- Any numeric/missing mismatch triggers E_MISSINGNESS before diff output.

title: Refusal Framework & Error Modeling
description:
Background
- Refusals are operator handoffs; must be precise and actionable.

Goals
- Standardize refusal codes, messages, and detail fields.
- Keep domain refusals distinct from process-level errors.

Deliverables
- Refusal enum/types with mapping to outputs.
- Shared utilities for attaching context (file, record, column, keys).

title: Input bytes, BOM stripping, and encoding guardrails
description:
Background
- Input is byte-oriented; UTF-8 BOM allowed, UTF-16/32 and NUL must refuse.

Scope
- Strip UTF-8 BOM before any parsing.
- Detect UTF-16/UTF-32 BOM and refuse with E_ENCODING.
- Detect NUL byte in first 8KB and refuse with E_ENCODING.

Considerations
- Keep detection deterministic and fast (single scan).
- Refusal must include concrete remediation (re-export as UTF-8).

Acceptance
- Files with UTF-16/UTF-32 BOM or NUL in first 8KB return E_ENCODING before CSV parsing.

title: Key discovery for suggested reruns
description:
Background
- rvl suggests --key candidates but never auto-selects.

Scope
- Identify joinable candidates: present in both files, non-empty, unique within each file.
- Identify perfect candidates: joinable + key sets match.
- Print up to 3 candidates (perfect first, then header order) with copy/paste-safe identifiers.

Acceptance
- Suggestions are deterministic and only emitted when criteria are satisfied.

title: Phase - Future Work: Directory diffs
description:
Background
- v1 idea to compare folder-level exports.

Goals
- Define directory traversal rules, file pairing, and refusal semantics.
- Ensure deterministic ordering and reporting.

Acceptance
- Proposed spec and prototype plan.

title: Diff engine and coverage tests
description:
Background
- Coverage math and top-K selection drive REAL vs REFUSAL.

Scope
- Tests for total_change, top-K contributor ordering, and E_DIFFUSE.
- Verify threshold application and minimal prefix selection for REAL CHANGE.

Acceptance
- Coverage math matches spec and is deterministic across runs.

title: Blank line and blank record skipping
description:
Background
- Leading blank lines and blank data records must be ignored deterministically.

Scope
- Skip leading ASCII spaces/tabs-only lines before header detection.
- After header, ignore blank data records (all fields empty after ASCII-trim).
- Never skip the header record even if empty.

Acceptance
- Row counts exclude blank data records and align with spec definitions.

title: Phase - Future Work
description:
Background
- These items are explicitly out of v0 scope but captured for continuity.

Goals
- Preserve intent for v1+ features and go-to-market tasks.
- Keep future commitments separate from v0 completion criteria.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Note
- All items here are explicitly outside v0 scope.
- They should be revisited only after Phase 1 completion and validation against the success criteria.

title: CSV Input & Dialect Detection
description:
Background
- rvl must parse real-world CSVs deterministically while refusing ambiguity.

Goals
- Implement BOM handling, sep= directive, auto-detect scoring, and escape fallback.
- Ensure parser behavior is byte-oriented and aligns with docs/PLAN_RVL.md.

Deliverables
- Dialect detection pipeline with tie-breaks and E_DIALECT handling.
- CSV reader configuration (RFC4180 first, backslash fallback).
- Record-width normalization and row/column count tracking.

title: Deterministic ordering for contributors and samples
description:
Background
- Output must be deterministic across runs for trust and test stability.

Scope
- Order contributors by: contribution desc, row_id asc (bytes or numeric index), column asc (bytes).
- Ensure sample lists (columns/keys) are sorted by raw bytes and truncated deterministically.

Acceptance
- Ordering rules match PLAN_RVL.md and are stable across identical inputs.

title: Output Formatting & JSON Schema
description:
Background
- Output is the product; must be screenshot-able and machine-stable.

Goals
- Implement human output headers/body for all outcomes per docs/PLAN_RVL.md.
- Implement JSON schema exactly (single object, stable fields).

Deliverables
- Human output renderer with number formatting and sign rules.
- JSON serializer with encoded identifiers and refusal detail objects.

title: Key handling tests (E_NO_KEY/E_KEY_*)
description:
Background
- Key alignment errors must be precise and deterministic.

Scope
- Tests for E_NO_KEY, E_KEY_EMPTY, E_KEY_DUP, E_KEY_MISMATCH.
- Include key encoding (u8:/hex:) and suggestion formatting.

Acceptance
- Refusal details include correct file/record/key examples.

title: ASCII-trim utilities (spaces/tabs)
description:
Background
- ASCII-trim is a core normalization step for headers, keys, and cell parsing.

Scope
- Implement reusable trim for 0x20 and 0x09 only (no Unicode).
- Apply consistently to headers, keys, and numeric cell parsing.

Acceptance
- Trim behavior matches the spec; no other whitespace is removed.

title: Phase 1: RVL v0 Core Implementation
description:
Background
- Implements the v0 spec in docs/PLAN_RVL.md for rvl (CSV diff with explainable outputs).
- This epic is the umbrella for all code that must exist before v0 can be considered done.

Goals
- Deliver deterministic REAL CHANGE / NO REAL CHANGE / REFUSAL outputs per spec.
- Keep parsing strict, refusal-driven, and self-explanatory.
- Maintain performance and determinism with minimal memory overhead.

Non-goals
- No v1 features (parquet/JSON input, directory diffs, time windows).
- No dashboards or analytics.

Acceptance (epic)
- All child tasks completed and tests pass.
- docs/PLAN_RVL.md is fully implemented with no spec gaps.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Meta
- Epics are grouped by area (cli/csv/normalize/alignment/numeric/diff/output/refusal/tests/perf).
- Dependencies flow from parsing -> normalization -> alignment -> numeric typing -> diff -> output.
- Tests depend on the features they validate.
- "Phase - Future Work" items are explicitly non-v0 and should not block v0 completion.

title: Document memory expectations for key-mode joins
description:
Background
- Key mode loads one side into memory; users need expectations.

Scope
- Document in code/comments the memory behavior and any safeguards.
- Consider optional warnings when row count is large (if feasible).

Acceptance
- Key-mode memory expectations are explicit and reviewed.

title: Missing tokens, mixed types, and missingness tests
description:
Background
- Column typing and missingness refusals are core to correctness.

Scope
- Tests for E_MIXED_TYPES, E_MISSINGNESS, and E_NO_NUMERIC.
- Validate missing token handling (case-insensitive, ASCII-trim).

Acceptance
- Each refusal is triggered by a minimal fixture with a clear example.

title: Refusal detail payloads & Next steps
description:
Background
- Refusals must include concrete examples and Next steps for operators.

Scope
- Implement detail objects per refusal type (file/record/column/value, key samples, tied delimiters).
- Implement Next: rerun/remediation messages with copy/paste safe identifiers.
- Ensure REFUSAL output uses available dialect info when known.

Acceptance
- Refusals are actionable and conform to PLAN_RVL.md wording requirements.

title: Identifier encoding for JSON output
description:
Background
- JSON output requires unambiguous identifier encoding.

Scope
- Implement JSON identifier encoding: u8:<utf8> if valid UTF-8 and no ASCII control bytes; otherwise hex:<lowercase-hex>.
- Apply to row_id, column names, key_column, and any identifiers in refusal detail.

Acceptance
- JSON output uses encoded identifiers exclusively; no raw bytes.

title: sep= directive handling
description:
Background
- Excel-style sep=<char> can appear as the first non-blank line.

Scope
- Detect sep=<single ASCII byte> on the first non-blank line (after stripping trailing ).
- Validate delimiter byte (0x01-0x7F, not quote/CR/LF).
- If valid and --delimiter not set, use it and skip the line.
- If invalid, treat it as a normal header line.

Acceptance
- sep= lines only affect parsing when they are the first non-blank line and valid.

title: Coverage calculation and E_DIFFUSE handling
description:
Background
- If top-K contributors do not reach threshold, rvl must refuse.

Scope
- Compute coverage = sum(top contributors)/total_change.
- If coverage < threshold, emit E_DIFFUSE with top_k_coverage and threshold.
- Otherwise emit REAL CHANGE with smallest prefix reaching threshold.

Acceptance
- E_DIFFUSE is deterministic and emitted only when required.

title: Test harness and fixture layout
description:
Background
- A consistent test layout keeps the spec enforceable over time.

Scope
- Set up tests/ structure and helpers for invoking rvl in human and JSON modes.
- Provide shared fixtures directory for CSV samples.

Acceptance
- Tests can run via `cargo test` and reuse shared helpers/fixtures.

title: Human output headers & number formatting
description:
Background
- Output must be screenshot-able and consistent with spec formatting.

Scope
- Emit common header lines for REAL/NO REAL and REFUSAL modes.
- Implement number formatting rules: commas for integers, shortest round-trippable floats, explicit +/- on deltas.
- Percentages (threshold/coverage) printed with one decimal place.

Acceptance
- Header lines and formatting match examples in docs/PLAN_RVL.md.

title: Alignment & Key Handling
description:
Background
- Alignment rules (row-order vs key) drive correctness and refusal semantics.

Goals
- Implement key mode (join + key validation) and row-order mode with row-count checks.
- Implement key discovery and shuffle detection to emit E_NEED_KEY when required.

Deliverables
- Key parsing (u8:/hex:), validation, and key-set mismatch reporting.
- Row-order alignment path with E_ROWCOUNT.
- Shuffle detection + suggested --key candidates.

title: Human and JSON output golden tests
description:
Background
- Output format is the product; regression must be caught.

Scope
- Golden tests for REAL CHANGE, NO REAL CHANGE, and REFUSAL (human).
- JSON schema tests verifying required fields, encoding, and null behaviors.

Acceptance
- Output stays stable and matches docs/PLAN_RVL.md.

title: CLI exit code and stream routing tests
description:
Background
- Exit codes and stdout/stderr routing are contractual.

Scope
- Tests that REAL CHANGE exits 1, NO REAL CHANGE exits 0, REFUSAL exits 2.
- Verify stream routing for human vs JSON mode.

Acceptance
- Exit/stream behavior matches docs/PLAN_RVL.md in all modes.

title: Total change (L1) and top-K contributor heap
description:
Background
- REAL CHANGE depends on total_change and a minimal set of top contributors.

Scope
- Maintain running total_change (sum of contributions).
- Maintain fixed-size min-heap of MAX_CONTRIBUTORS contributors.
- Avoid storing all cell deltas.

Acceptance
- top-K heap is deterministic and bounded; total_change is correct.

title: Delimiter flag parsing & validation
description:
Background
- --delimiter accepts named values, 0xNN hex bytes, or single ASCII chars.

Scope
- Implement parsing for: comma, tab, semicolon, pipe, caret, 0xNN, and literal single ASCII byte.
- Reject invalid bytes (outside 0x01-0x7F, quotes, CR/LF).
- Treat invalid delimiter values as CLI argument errors (exit 2).

Considerations
- No escape sequences: "tab" or 0x09 only; no \t.
- Interpret the provided value literally; never guess.

Acceptance
- Correct mapping for all accepted tokens.
- Invalid delimiter values fail fast with exit code 2.

title: Diff Engine & Contributor Selection
description:
Background
- The core value is a minimal ranked list of numeric changes with coverage.

Goals
- Compute total_change (L1), max_abs_delta, and top-K contributors.
- Enforce threshold and E_DIFFUSE behavior.

Deliverables
- Streaming accumulation and fixed-size heap for top contributors.
- Deterministic ordering/tie-breaks.

title: Header normalization & duplicate detection tests
description:
Background
- Column matching depends on normalized headers and duplicate detection.

Scope
- Tests for ASCII-trim, __rvl_col_<n> replacement, and duplicate headers -> E_HEADERS.

Acceptance
- Column matching is byte-for-byte after normalization in tests.

title: Key-mode join & key-set validation
description:
Background
- Key mode aligns rows by exact key match and must reject duplicates/mismatches.

Scope
- Build key map for one side; detect duplicates -> E_KEY_DUP (with first duplicate + record number).
- Join on key; after join, verify no missing/extra keys -> E_KEY_MISMATCH with samples.
- Count rows_aligned as key count.

Acceptance
- Key-mode alignment is deterministic and emits correct refusal details.

title: Initialize Rust crate and module layout
description:
Background
- We need a predictable crate structure to map spec sections to code.

Scope
- Create Cargo project layout if not present (src/main.rs, src/lib.rs optional).
- Establish module folders aligned to PLAN_RVL.md: csv/, diff/, output/, refusal/.

Considerations
- Keep the crate minimal; no extra binaries.
- Prefer explicit modules over sprawling main.rs.

Acceptance
- `cargo build` succeeds (once dependencies are in place).
- Module paths reflect intended ownership of CSV parsing, diff engine, and output.

title: Column typing & numeric intersection
description:
Background
- Only common numeric columns are compared; mixed types must refuse.

Scope
- Determine numeric columns where all aligned rows are either numeric pairs or both missing.
- Refuse E_MIXED_TYPES if a column contains both numeric and non-numeric tokens.
- Ignore non-numeric columns (but count/report old_only/new_only).

Acceptance
- Numeric columns are identified exactly per spec, with correct refusal behavior.

title: Refusal codes enum and mapping
description:
Background
- Refusal codes are part of the public contract.

Scope
- Define canonical refusal codes (E_IO, E_ENCODING, E_CSV_PARSE, E_HEADERS, E_NO_KEY, E_KEY_EMPTY, E_KEY_DUP, E_KEY_MISMATCH, E_ROWCOUNT, E_NEED_KEY, E_DIALECT, E_MIXED_TYPES, E_NO_NUMERIC, E_MISSINGNESS, E_DIFFUSE).
- Map each code to a human message template and JSON refusal payload.

Acceptance
- Each refusal code has a consistent message and detail structure.

title: Human REAL CHANGE body formatting
description:
Background
- REAL CHANGE output is the primary UX for users.

Scope
- Print contributor list with ranked numbering and (old -> new) values.
- Include coverage line: "N cells explain X% ...".
- Add tail statement: "Everything else..." per spec.

Acceptance
- Output matches formatting in docs/PLAN_RVL.md and is deterministic.

title: Delimiter detection and E_DIALECT tests
description:
Background
- Auto-detect and sep= behavior are easy to regress.

Scope
- Tests for candidate scoring, tie-breaks, sep= override, and header_fields==1 guard.
- Verify E_DIALECT outputs include Next rerun guidance.

Acceptance
- Tests cover ambiguous, identical-tie, and forced delimiter cases.

title: Numeric parsing for allowed formats
description:
Background
- v0 supports plain numbers, US thousands separators, currency prefix, and accounting parentheses.

Scope
- Parse finite f64 for: plain, scientific notation, thousands (3-digit groups), $ prefix, optional leading +/-, and accounting parentheses (force negative).
- Reject invalid commas (e.g., 12,34) and non-finite values.

Considerations
- Keep parsing byte-oriented and deterministic; no locale.

Acceptance
- All numeric examples in docs/PLAN_RVL.md parse correctly.

title: Large-file performance smoke tests
description:
Background
- Even without full benchmarks, a basic smoke test prevents regressions.

Scope
- Create synthetic large CSVs for local perf sanity checks.
- Ensure row-order path remains I/O bound and stable.

Acceptance
- Documented procedure and sample results for large-file runs.

title: CSV parsing mode: RFC4180 + backslash fallback
description:
Background
- Parsing must prefer RFC4180 quoting but allow backslash escape if RFC4180 hard-fails.

Scope
- Configure csv/csv-core reader with flexible records.
- Attempt RFC4180 first; on hard failure, retry with backslash escape.
- Record and report which escape mode was used in output receipts.
- If both fail, refuse E_CSV_PARSE with first failing record if available.

Acceptance
- Escape mode is printed in Dialect(old/new) lines and JSON dialect fields.

title: Numeric Parsing & Column Typing
description:
Background
- v0 only compares numeric columns and refuses mixed/missingness cases.

Goals
- Implement missing-token detection, numeric parsing for allowed formats, and column typing rules.
- Enforce E_MIXED_TYPES, E_MISSINGNESS, E_NO_NUMERIC.

Deliverables
- Robust numeric parser (currency, separators, parentheses).
- Column typing pass and numeric intersection logic.

title: Delimiter auto-detection scoring & tie-break
description:
Background
- Delimiter selection must be deterministic and refuse ambiguity.

Scope
- Implement candidate set: comma, tab, semicolon, pipe, caret.
- Sample header + up to 200 records or 64KB (blank records skipped).
- Score each candidate by (records_parsed, mode_count, mode_fields) with RFC4180 first, backslash fallback if RFC4180 fails early.
- Tie-break: compare normalized sample output; if identical, use candidate order (comma>tab>semicolon>pipe>caret).
- Guard: if auto-detect yields header_fields==1, refuse E_DIALECT with Next: rerun suggestion.

Acceptance
- E_DIALECT emitted for ambiguous/undetectable delimiters with actionable Next steps.

title: Phase - Future Work: 60s install + distribution
description:
Background
- PLAN_RVL.md requires <60s install (prebuilt binaries + Homebrew tap).

Goals
- Define packaging pipeline and install scripts for macOS.
- Ensure versioning and release artifacts are consistent.

Acceptance
- Release checklist and automation plan (no implementation yet).

title: Human NO REAL CHANGE body formatting
description:
Background
- NO REAL CHANGE output must be explicit and confidence-building.

Scope
- Print max_abs_delta line and explicit statement of no deltas above tolerance.
- Include counts (rows, numeric columns, cells).

Acceptance
- Output matches the example format and wording in docs/PLAN_RVL.md.

title: Phase - Future Work: Parquet/JSON input support
description:
Background
- v1 idea from PLAN_RVL.md; explicitly out of v0 scope.

Goals
- Evaluate non-CSV inputs (parquet/JSON) and impact on parsing/diff engine.
- Define refusal semantics for unsupported/malformed inputs.

Acceptance
- Decision doc on whether/how to add parquet/JSON, with spec deltas.

title: Human REFUSAL output formatting
description:
Background
- Refusals must be operator handoffs with a concrete next step.

Scope
- Print refusal header (Compared/Alignment/Settings, plus Dialect if known).
- Print one-line reason with refusal code and first concrete example.
- Print Next: rerun or remediation command per spec.

Acceptance
- Refusal output is precise, actionable, and matches PLAN_RVL.md examples.

title: Phase - Future Work: Launch page + design partner loop
description:
Background
- PLAN_RVL.md calls for 15 design partners and a release page with 3 examples.

Goals
- Draft the release page content and example outputs.
- Define feedback loop and success metric tracking (100 weekly pasteouts).

Acceptance
- Content plan and partner outreach checklist.

title: No numeric columns refusal (E_NO_NUMERIC)
description:
Background
- If no numeric overlap exists after typing, rvl must refuse.

Scope
- After column typing, if numeric_columns == 0, emit E_NO_NUMERIC.
- Include counts and a short deterministic sample list of columns if available.

Acceptance
- E_NO_NUMERIC is raised before diff logic runs.

title: Performance & Large-File Behavior
description:
Background
- rvl must handle large CSVs efficiently while staying deterministic.

Goals
- Keep streaming paths allocation-light and bounded.
- Define memory expectations for key-mode joins.

Deliverables
- Performance guidance/tests where practical.
- Parser bakeoff plan + benchmarks before v0 is declared done.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Reminder
- Parser bakeoff is required before declaring v0 complete (per PLAN_RVL.md).
- Use the CSV torture corpus to evaluate compatibility and performance.

title: Missing token detection
description:
Background
- Missing tokens are treated before numeric parsing and are case-insensitive for letters.

Scope
- Implement missing tokens: empty string, -, NA, N/A, NULL, NAN, NONE.
- Apply ASCII-trim before matching.
- Ensure tokens are not interpreted for key values.

Acceptance
- Missing token detection is deterministic and applied consistently in numeric parsing.

title: CLI argument parsing & validation
description:
Background
- CLI contract (flags, defaults, error handling) is the user-facing API.

Scope
- Parse positional old/new CSV paths and flags: --key, --threshold, --tolerance, --delimiter, --json.
- Enforce numeric constraints: 0 < threshold <= 1; tolerance >= 0.
- Treat invalid values as CLI argument errors (exit 2).

Considerations
- Keep error messaging concise and deterministic.
- Ensure default values match the spec (threshold=0.95, tolerance=1e-9).

Acceptance
- CLI help matches the spec and examples.
- Invalid numeric values exit with code 2 before any parsing begins.

title: Process-level errors vs domain refusals
description:
Background
- CLI parse errors and panics must not be emitted as domain refusals.

Scope
- Distinguish domain refusals (E_*) from process failures.
- Ensure JSON mode only emits domain JSON on successful evaluation; process errors go to stderr without JSON.

Acceptance
- Clear separation of error paths; no partial JSON on process failures.

title: Header normalization & duplicate detection
description:
Background
- Headers are ASCII-trimmed and empty headers become __rvl_col_<n>.

Scope
- Normalize header names after ASCII-trim; replace empty with __rvl_col_<1-based>.
- Enforce uniqueness of normalized headers; refuse E_HEADERS on duplicates.
- Preserve normalized byte strings for matching and output identifiers.

Acceptance
- Column matching is byte-for-byte after normalization.
- Duplicate headers trigger E_HEADERS with a clear reason.

title: Tolerance application & max_abs_delta tracking
description:
Background
- Tolerance zeros small deltas and max_abs_delta is used in NO REAL CHANGE output.

Scope
- Apply abs(new-old) <= tolerance => contribution 0.
- Track max_abs_delta on raw delta before zeroing.

Acceptance
- NO REAL CHANGE output reports correct max_abs_delta and tolerance relation.

title: Tests & Fixtures (v0 spec)
description:
Background
- v0 requires explicit coverage for parsing, alignment, refusals, and outputs.

Goals
- Build a must-pass suite that mirrors the PLAN_RVL.md checklist.
- Maintain deterministic fixtures for parser and output validation.

Deliverables
- Unit/integration tests for all refusal codes and output modes.
- CSV torture corpus fixtures (>=50 real-world samples).

title: Shuffle detection and E_NEED_KEY gating
description:
Background
- Row-order alignment must refuse if a perfect key candidate reveals reorder and total_change > 0.

Scope
